descript.abstract: King County, Washington polygon boundaries and extensive codes for wetlands identified as environmentally significant.
descript.purpose: The datalayer was derived from a working (maintenance) copy of the Sensitive Areas Ordinance GIS data set WETLDSAO. As of October 1997, the content of the two coverages is the same. This datalayer is the recommended data source for wetlands which pertain to development regulation, and is suitable for reference, medium to small scale map displays, and generalized analyses.

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to Harvard University Affiliates only. Affiliates are limited to current faculty, staff and students.
idinfo.useconst: For educational non-commercial use only. This data may not be redistributed by HGL users. King County data are made available with the understanding that they shall be used exclusively by the obtainer or his/her authorized agents.

cntperp.cntorg: GIS Section - King Co. DDES Department

horizpa.horizpar: This data set is not conflated to the King County Cadastral Base. The positional accuracy of this data set is undetermined.

citeinfo.title: King County GIS data.
citeinfo.othercit: 2 CD-ROMs; CD 1. Standard data -- CD 2. Parcel data.

srcinfo.srccontr: Source coverage data layer from which shapefile was converted.

procstep.procdesc: King County, Washington data was obtained via a CD-ROM. The data were in the format of ArcINFO coverages and were converted to shapefiles using the "coverage to shapefile" wizard in ArcToolbox, version 8.3. The shapefiles were then imported to ArcSDE Layers using the ArcSDE command line importing tool, shp2sde, version 8.3.

Perimeter of feature in coverage units.

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier from King County Wetland Inventory

edom.edomvd: Unique/Outstanding Wetland
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: Unique/outstanding wetland with the criteria of presence of species recognized by the federal government or State of Washington as endangered, threatened, or sensitive or outstanding potential habitat for those species.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: Unique/outstanding wetland; A = Presence of species recognized by the federal government or State of Washington as endangered, threatened, or sensitive or outstanding potential habitat for those species; B = Wetlands with a near equal proportion of open water to vegetative cover in dispersed patches in combination with a high diversity or mix of wetland subclasses.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: 1 = Unique/outstanding wetland; A = Presence of species recognized by the federal government or State of Washington as endangered, threatened, or sensitive or outstanding potential habitat for those species; C = Wetlands greater than 10 acres in size and having 3 or more wetland classes, one of which is open water.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: 1 = Unique/outstanding wetland; A = Presence of species recognized by the federal government or State of Washington as endangered, threatened, or sensitive or outstanding potential habitat for those species; D = The presence of plant associations of infrequent occurrence. These include estuaries and bogs.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: 1 = Unique/outstanding wetland; B = Wetlands with a near equal proportion of open water to vegetative cover in dispersed patches in combination with a high diversity or mix of wetland subclasses.

edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

These include estuaries and bogs.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: 1 = Unique/outstanding wetland; A = Presence of species recognized by the federal government or State of Washington as endangered, threatened, or sensitive or outstanding potential habitat for those species; B = Wetlands with a near equal proportion of open water to vegetative cover in dispersed patches in combination with a high diversity or mix of wetland subclasses; C = Wetlands greater than 10 acres in size and having 3 or more wetland classes, one of which is open water; D = The presence of plant associations of infrequent occurrence. These include estuaries and bogs.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: 2 = Significant: Wetlands that do not meet criteria for Unique/Outstanding or Low Concern.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: 3 = Low Concern - Wetlands that meet either of the following criteria: (1) Those wetlands 1 acre or less in size with 2 or less wetlands classes, a low diversity of wetland subclasses, and a high proportion of vegetative cover or open water. (2) Those wetlands that fall below the 10th percentile county-wide in 3 or more evaluation categories with both the biology and hydrology percentiles less than 75%.
edom.edomvds: King County Sensitve Areas Map Folio

edom.edomvd: NWI Wetlands that are not classified in the King County Wetland Inventory
edom.edomvds: NWI
